e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it eliminates the intentional bias in reporting earnings, fostering greater transparency and trust with investors. While some investors may initially misunderstand the true performance, the long-term benefits of honest financial reporting outweigh the potential short-term confusion. This approach can enhance the company’s reputation and reduce legal risks associated with biased reporting.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness, ensuring that all stakeholders have a clear understanding of the company's financial performance. It should avoid biases that can mislead investors, even if they are anticipated, and prioritize clear communication regarding any changes in reporting practices. Additionally, ethical reporting should consider the impact on all investor types, ensuring that retail investors, who may lack the sophistication to adjust their perceptions, are not disadvantaged.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the transition to the new policy to investors effectively, especially to retail investors who may be less familiar with the changes. Additionally, I would inquire about the steps they will take to ensure continued investor confidence and mitigate any potential misunderstanding or backlash following the policy change.
